intro: Tropaeolum pulchellum, commonly known as the "spider flower," is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Tropaeolaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, bell-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, edible tubers similar to those of the common garden nasturtium. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly peppery taste, making it a popular choice for both ornamental and culinary use. Tropaeolum pulchellum thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a versatile addition to gardens and container plantings.
